result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason Abel Rojas-Lopez

records.addlTxt: Order Authorizing Release of Bond, signed and filed.
Authorization for Release of Bond, filed.
Letter to Court re: Authorization of Release of Bond, filed
Motion to Unseal Search Warrant Affidavit, filed.

Defendant Jason Abel Rojas-Lopez in court.  Attorney Michael G. Levine in court for Jason Abel Rojas-Lopez.  Prosecuting attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. for Patrick Franken in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling conference.  Defense awaiting unsealing of warrant to discuss possible motions with the Defendant. Court advised there are no pending requests for substitution.  Court finds good cause to adjourn this matter for further scheduling conference.   Case adjourned to Br. 9. Scheduling conference scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jason Abel Rojas-Lopez appeared by video.  Attorney Michael G. Levine appeared by video for Jason Abel Rojas-Lopez.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Van Grunsven Branch 09.   Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 09.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
/from Attorney Robert Levine dated 8/31/2022, WITHDRAWING Request for Substitution of Judge, filed
Request for Substitution of Judge, by Defendant, filed.

Defendant Jason Abel Rojas-Lopez in court with Attorney Michael G. Levine.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Co-defendant 22cf2930 is set for a preliminary hearing 9/15/2022. Defense Counsel would like to adjourn this matter to that same date. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Any cash bail on deposit to be returned to the surety. 
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Attorney Michael G. Levine in court.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Van Grunsven, Branch 9.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.
